47static struct drm_device *intel_hdmi_to_dev(struct intel_hdmi *intel_hdmi)
48{
49 return hdmi_to_dig_port(intel_hdmi)->base.base.dev;
50}
51
52static void
53assert_hdmi_port_disabled(struct intel_hdmi *intel_hdmi)
54{
55 struct drm_device *dev = intel_hdmi_to_dev(intel_hdmi);
56 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
57 uint32_t enabled_bits;
58
59 enabled_bits = HAS_DDI(dev) ? DDI_BUF_CTL_ENABLE : SDVO_ENABLE;
60
61 WARN(I915_READ(intel_hdmi->hdmi_reg) & enabled_bits,
62 "HDMI port enabled, expecting disabled\n");
63}
64
65struct intel_hdmi *enc_to_intel_hdmi(struct drm_encoder *encoder)
66{
67 struct intel_digital_port *intel_dig_port =
68 container_of(encoder, struct intel_digital_port, base.base);
69 return &intel_dig_port->hdmi;
70}
71
72static struct intel_hdmi *intel_attached_hdmi(struct drm_connector *connector)
73{
74 return enc_to_intel_hdmi(&intel_attached_encoder(connector)->base);
75}
76
77static u32 g4x_infoframe_index(enum hdmi_infoframe_type type)
78{
79 switch (type) {
80 case HDMI_INFOFRAME_TYPE_AVI:
81 return VIDEO_DIP_SELECT_AVI;
82 case HDMI_INFOFRAME_TYPE_SPD:
83 return VIDEO_DIP_SELECT_SPD;
84 case HDMI_INFOFRAME_TYPE_VENDOR:
85 return VIDEO_DIP_SELECT_VENDOR;
86 default:
87 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("unknown info frame type %d\n", type);
88 return 0;
89 }
90}
91
92static u32 g4x_infoframe_enable(enum hdmi_infoframe_type type)
93{
94 switch (type) {
95 case HDMI_INFOFRAME_TYPE_AVI:
96 return VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_AVI;
97 case HDMI_INFOFRAME_TYPE_SPD:
98 return VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_SPD;
99 case HDMI_INFOFRAME_TYPE_VENDOR:
100 return VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_VENDOR;
101 default:
102 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("unknown info frame type %d\n", type);
103 return 0;
104 }
105}
106
107static u32 hsw_infoframe_enable(enum hdmi_infoframe_type type)
108{
109 switch (type) {
110 case HDMI_INFOFRAME_TYPE_AVI:
111 return VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_AVI_HSW;
112 case HDMI_INFOFRAME_TYPE_SPD:
113 return VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_SPD_HSW;
114 case HDMI_INFOFRAME_TYPE_VENDOR:
115 return VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_VS_HSW;
116 default:
117 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("unknown info frame type %d\n", type);
118 return 0;
119 }
120}
121
122static u32 hsw_dip_data_reg(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv,
123 enum transcoder cpu_transcoder,
124 enum hdmi_infoframe_type type,
125 int i)
126{
127 switch (type) {
128 case HDMI_INFOFRAME_TYPE_AVI:
129 return HSW_TVIDEO_DIP_AVI_DATA(cpu_transcoder, i);
130 case HDMI_INFOFRAME_TYPE_SPD:
131 return HSW_TVIDEO_DIP_SPD_DATA(cpu_transcoder, i);
132 case HDMI_INFOFRAME_TYPE_VENDOR:
133 return HSW_TVIDEO_DIP_VS_DATA(cpu_transcoder, i);
134 default:
135 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("unknown info frame type %d\n", type);
136 return 0;
137 }
138}
139
140static void g4x_write_infoframe(struct drm_encoder *encoder,
141 enum hdmi_infoframe_type type,
142 const void *frame, ssize_t len)
143{
144 const uint32_t *data = frame;
145 struct drm_device *dev = encoder->dev;
146 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
147 u32 val = I915_READ(VIDEO_DIP_CTL);
148 int i;
149
150 WARN(!(val & VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE), "Writing DIP with CTL reg disabled\n");
151
152 val &= ~(VIDEO_DIP_SELECT_MASK | 0xf); /* clear DIP data offset */
153 val |= g4x_infoframe_index(type);
154
155 val &= ~g4x_infoframe_enable(type);
156
157 I915_WRITE(VIDEO_DIP_CTL, val);
158
159 mmiowb();
160 for (i = 0; i < len; i += 4) {
161 I915_WRITE(VIDEO_DIP_DATA, *data);
162 data++;
163 }
164 /* Write every possible data byte to force correct ECC calculation. */
165 for (; i < VIDEO_DIP_DATA_SIZE; i += 4)
166 I915_WRITE(VIDEO_DIP_DATA, 0);
167 mmiowb();
168
169 val |= g4x_infoframe_enable(type);
170 val &= ~VIDEO_DIP_FREQ_MASK;
171 val |= VIDEO_DIP_FREQ_VSYNC;
172
173 I915_WRITE(VIDEO_DIP_CTL, val);
174 POSTING_READ(VIDEO_DIP_CTL);
175}
176
177static bool g4x_infoframe_enabled(struct drm_encoder *encoder)
178{
179 struct drm_device *dev = encoder->dev;
180 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
181 struct intel_digital_port *intel_dig_port = enc_to_dig_port(encoder);
182 u32 val = I915_READ(VIDEO_DIP_CTL);
183
184 if ((val & VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE) == 0)
185 return false;
186
187 if ((val & VIDEO_DIP_PORT_MASK) != VIDEO_DIP_PORT(intel_dig_port->port))
188 return false;
189
190 return val & (VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_AVI |
191 VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_VENDOR | VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_SPD);
192}
193
194static void ibx_write_infoframe(struct drm_encoder *encoder,
195 enum hdmi_infoframe_type type,
196 const void *frame, ssize_t len)
197{
198 const uint32_t *data = frame;
199 struct drm_device *dev = encoder->dev;
200 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
201 struct intel_crtc *intel_crtc = to_intel_crtc(encoder->crtc);
202 int i, reg = TVIDEO_DIP_CTL(intel_crtc->pipe);
203 u32 val = I915_READ(reg);
204
205 WARN(!(val & VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE), "Writing DIP with CTL reg disabled\n");
206
207 val &= ~(VIDEO_DIP_SELECT_MASK | 0xf); /* clear DIP data offset */
208 val |= g4x_infoframe_index(type);
209
210 val &= ~g4x_infoframe_enable(type);
211
212 I915_WRITE(reg, val);
213
214 mmiowb();
215 for (i = 0; i < len; i += 4) {
216 I915_WRITE(TVIDEO_DIP_DATA(intel_crtc->pipe), *data);
217 data++;
218 }
219 /* Write every possible data byte to force correct ECC calculation. */
220 for (; i < VIDEO_DIP_DATA_SIZE; i += 4)
221 I915_WRITE(TVIDEO_DIP_DATA(intel_crtc->pipe), 0);
222 mmiowb();
223
224 val |= g4x_infoframe_enable(type);
225 val &= ~VIDEO_DIP_FREQ_MASK;
226 val |= VIDEO_DIP_FREQ_VSYNC;
227
228 I915_WRITE(reg, val);
229 POSTING_READ(reg);
230}
231
232static bool ibx_infoframe_enabled(struct drm_encoder *encoder)
233{
234 struct drm_device *dev = encoder->dev;
235 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
236 struct intel_crtc *intel_crtc = to_intel_crtc(encoder->crtc);
237 struct intel_digital_port *intel_dig_port = enc_to_dig_port(encoder);
238 int reg = TVIDEO_DIP_CTL(intel_crtc->pipe);
239 u32 val = I915_READ(reg);
240
241 if ((val & VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE) == 0)
242 return false;
243
244 if ((val & VIDEO_DIP_PORT_MASK) != VIDEO_DIP_PORT(intel_dig_port->port))
245 return false;
246
247 return val & (VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_AVI |
248 VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_VENDOR | VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_GAMUT |
249 VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_SPD | VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_GCP);
250}
251
252static void cpt_write_infoframe(struct drm_encoder *encoder,
253 enum hdmi_infoframe_type type,
254 const void *frame, ssize_t len)
255{
256 const uint32_t *data = frame;
257 struct drm_device *dev = encoder->dev;
258 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
259 struct intel_crtc *intel_crtc = to_intel_crtc(encoder->crtc);
260 int i, reg = TVIDEO_DIP_CTL(intel_crtc->pipe);
261 u32 val = I915_READ(reg);
262
263 WARN(!(val & VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE), "Writing DIP with CTL reg disabled\n");
264
265 val &= ~(VIDEO_DIP_SELECT_MASK | 0xf); /* clear DIP data offset */
266 val |= g4x_infoframe_index(type);
267
268 /* The DIP control register spec says that we need to update the AVI
269 * infoframe without clearing its enable bit */
270 if (type != HDMI_INFOFRAME_TYPE_AVI)
271 val &= ~g4x_infoframe_enable(type);
272
273 I915_WRITE(reg, val);
274
275 mmiowb();
276 for (i = 0; i < len; i += 4) {
277 I915_WRITE(TVIDEO_DIP_DATA(intel_crtc->pipe), *data);
278 data++;
279 }
280 /* Write every possible data byte to force correct ECC calculation. */
281 for (; i < VIDEO_DIP_DATA_SIZE; i += 4)
282 I915_WRITE(TVIDEO_DIP_DATA(intel_crtc->pipe), 0);
283 mmiowb();
284
285 val |= g4x_infoframe_enable(type);
286 val &= ~VIDEO_DIP_FREQ_MASK;
287 val |= VIDEO_DIP_FREQ_VSYNC;
288
289 I915_WRITE(reg, val);
290 POSTING_READ(reg);
291}
292
293static bool cpt_infoframe_enabled(struct drm_encoder *encoder)
294{
295 struct drm_device *dev = encoder->dev;
296 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
297 struct intel_crtc *intel_crtc = to_intel_crtc(encoder->crtc);
298 int reg = TVIDEO_DIP_CTL(intel_crtc->pipe);
299 u32 val = I915_READ(reg);
300
301 if ((val & VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE) == 0)
302 return false;
303
304 return val & (VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_AVI |
305 VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_VENDOR | VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_GAMUT |
306 VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_SPD | VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_GCP);
307}

309static void vlv_write_infoframe(struct drm_encoder *encoder,
310 enum hdmi_infoframe_type type,
311 const void *frame, ssize_t len)
312{
313 const uint32_t *data = frame;
314 struct drm_device *dev = encoder->dev;
315 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
316 struct intel_crtc *intel_crtc = to_intel_crtc(encoder->crtc);
317 int i, reg = VLV_TVIDEO_DIP_CTL(intel_crtc->pipe);
318 u32 val = I915_READ(reg);
319
320 WARN(!(val & VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE), "Writing DIP with CTL reg disabled\n");
321
322 val &= ~(VIDEO_DIP_SELECT_MASK | 0xf); /* clear DIP data offset */
323 val |= g4x_infoframe_index(type);
324
325 val &= ~g4x_infoframe_enable(type);
326
327 I915_WRITE(reg, val);
328
329 mmiowb();
330 for (i = 0; i < len; i += 4) {
331 I915_WRITE(VLV_TVIDEO_DIP_DATA(intel_crtc->pipe), *data);
332 data++;
333 }
334 /* Write every possible data byte to force correct ECC calculation. */
335 for (; i < VIDEO_DIP_DATA_SIZE; i += 4)
336 I915_WRITE(VLV_TVIDEO_DIP_DATA(intel_crtc->pipe), 0);
337 mmiowb();
338
339 val |= g4x_infoframe_enable(type);
340 val &= ~VIDEO_DIP_FREQ_MASK;
341 val |= VIDEO_DIP_FREQ_VSYNC;
342
343 I915_WRITE(reg, val);
344 POSTING_READ(reg);
345}
346
347static bool vlv_infoframe_enabled(struct drm_encoder *encoder)
348{
349 struct drm_device *dev = encoder->dev;
350 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
351 struct intel_crtc *intel_crtc = to_intel_crtc(encoder->crtc);
352 struct intel_digital_port *intel_dig_port = enc_to_dig_port(encoder);
353 int reg = VLV_TVIDEO_DIP_CTL(intel_crtc->pipe);
354 u32 val = I915_READ(reg);
355
356 if ((val & VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE) == 0)
357 return false;
358
359 if ((val & VIDEO_DIP_PORT_MASK) != VIDEO_DIP_PORT(intel_dig_port->port))
360 return false;
361
362 return val & (VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_AVI |
363 VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_VENDOR | VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_GAMUT |
364 VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_SPD | VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_GCP);
365}
366
367static void hsw_write_infoframe(struct drm_encoder *encoder,
368 enum hdmi_infoframe_type type,
369 const void *frame, ssize_t len)
370{
371 const uint32_t *data = frame;
372 struct drm_device *dev = encoder->dev;
373 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
374 struct intel_crtc *intel_crtc = to_intel_crtc(encoder->crtc);
375 enum transcoder cpu_transcoder = intel_crtc->config->cpu_transcoder;
376 u32 ctl_reg = HSW_TVIDEO_DIP_CTL(cpu_transcoder);
377 u32 data_reg;
378 int i;
379 u32 val = I915_READ(ctl_reg);
380
381 data_reg = hsw_dip_data_reg(dev_priv, cpu_transcoder, type, 0);
382 if (data_reg == 0)
383 return;
384
385 val &= ~hsw_infoframe_enable(type);
386 I915_WRITE(ctl_reg, val);
387
388 mmiowb();
389 for (i = 0; i < len; i += 4) {
390 I915_WRITE(hsw_dip_data_reg(dev_priv, cpu_transcoder,
391 type, i >> 2), *data);
392 data++;
393 }
394 /* Write every possible data byte to force correct ECC calculation. */
395 for (; i < VIDEO_DIP_DATA_SIZE; i += 4)
396 I915_WRITE(hsw_dip_data_reg(dev_priv, cpu_transcoder,
397 type, i >> 2), 0);
398 mmiowb();
399
400 val |= hsw_infoframe_enable(type);
401 I915_WRITE(ctl_reg, val);
402 POSTING_READ(ctl_reg);
403}
404
405static bool hsw_infoframe_enabled(struct drm_encoder *encoder)
406{
407 struct drm_device *dev = encoder->dev;
408 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
409 struct intel_crtc *intel_crtc = to_intel_crtc(encoder->crtc);
410 u32 ctl_reg = HSW_TVIDEO_DIP_CTL(intel_crtc->config->cpu_transcoder);
411 u32 val = I915_READ(ctl_reg);
412
413 return val & (VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_VSC_HSW | VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_AVI_HSW |
414 VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_GCP_HSW | VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_VS_HSW |
415 VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_GMP_HSW | VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_SPD_HSW);
416}
417
418/*
419 * The data we write to the DIP data buffer registers is 1 byte bigger than the
420 * HDMI infoframe size because of an ECC/reserved byte at position 3 (starting
421 * at 0). It's also a byte used by DisplayPort so the same DIP registers can be
422 * used for both technologies.
423 *
424 * DW0: Reserved/ECC/DP | HB2 | HB1 | HB0
425 * DW1: DB3 | DB2 | DB1 | DB0
426 * DW2: DB7 | DB6 | DB5 | DB4
427 * DW3: ...
428 *
429 * (HB is Header Byte, DB is Data Byte)
430 *
431 * The hdmi pack() functions don't know about that hardware specific hole so we
432 * trick them by giving an offset into the buffer and moving back the header
433 * bytes by one.
434 */
435static void intel_write_infoframe(struct drm_encoder *encoder,
436 union hdmi_infoframe *frame)
437{
438 struct intel_hdmi *intel_hdmi = enc_to_intel_hdmi(encoder);
439 uint8_t buffer[VIDEO_DIP_DATA_SIZE];
440 ssize_t len;
441
442 /* see comment above for the reason for this offset */
443 len = hdmi_infoframe_pack(frame, buffer + 1, sizeof(buffer) - 1);
444 if (len < 0)
445 return;
446
447 /* Insert the 'hole' (see big comment above) at position 3 */
448 buffer[0] = buffer[1];
449 buffer[1] = buffer[2];
450 buffer[2] = buffer[3];
451 buffer[3] = 0;
452 len++;
453
454 intel_hdmi->write_infoframe(encoder, frame->any.type, buffer, len);
455}
456
457static void intel_hdmi_set_avi_infoframe(struct drm_encoder *encoder,
458 const struct drm_display_mode *adjusted_mode)
459{
460 struct intel_hdmi *intel_hdmi = enc_to_intel_hdmi(encoder);
461 struct intel_crtc *intel_crtc = to_intel_crtc(encoder->crtc);
462 union hdmi_infoframe frame;
463 int ret;
464
465 ret = drm_hdmi_avi_infoframe_from_display_mode(&frame.avi,
466 adjusted_mode);
467 if (ret < 0) {
468 DRM_ERROR("couldn't fill AVI infoframe\n");
469 return;
470 }
471
472 if (intel_hdmi->rgb_quant_range_selectable) {
473 if (intel_crtc->config->limited_color_range)
474 frame.avi.quantization_range =
475 HDMI_QUANTIZATION_RANGE_LIMITED;
476 else
477 frame.avi.quantization_range =
478 HDMI_QUANTIZATION_RANGE_FULL;
479 }
480
481 intel_write_infoframe(encoder, &frame);
482}
483
484static void intel_hdmi_set_spd_infoframe(struct drm_encoder *encoder)
485{
486 union hdmi_infoframe frame;
487 int ret;
488
489 ret = hdmi_spd_infoframe_init(&frame.spd, "Intel", "Integrated gfx");
490 if (ret < 0) {
491 DRM_ERROR("couldn't fill SPD infoframe\n");
492 return;
493 }
494
495 frame.spd.sdi = HDMI_SPD_SDI_PC;
496
497 intel_write_infoframe(encoder, &frame);
498}
499
500static void
501intel_hdmi_set_hdmi_infoframe(struct drm_encoder *encoder,
502 const struct drm_display_mode *adjusted_mode)
503{
504 union hdmi_infoframe frame;
505 int ret;
506
507 ret = drm_hdmi_vendor_infoframe_from_display_mode(&frame.vendor.hdmi,
508 adjusted_mode);
509 if (ret < 0)
510 return;
511
512 intel_write_infoframe(encoder, &frame);
513}
514
515static void g4x_set_infoframes(struct drm_encoder *encoder,
516 bool enable,
517 const struct drm_display_mode *adjusted_mode)
518{
519 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = encoder->dev->dev_private;
520 struct intel_digital_port *intel_dig_port = enc_to_dig_port(encoder);
521 struct intel_hdmi *intel_hdmi = &intel_dig_port->hdmi;
522 u32 reg = VIDEO_DIP_CTL;
523 u32 val = I915_READ(reg);
524 u32 port = VIDEO_DIP_PORT(intel_dig_port->port);
525
526 assert_hdmi_port_disabled(intel_hdmi);
527
528 /* If the registers were not initialized yet, they might be zeroes,
529 * which means we're selecting the AVI DIP and we're setting its
530 * frequency to once. This seems to really confuse the HW and make
531 * things stop working (the register spec says the AVI always needs to
532 * be sent every VSync). So here we avoid writing to the register more
533 * than we need and also explicitly select the AVI DIP and explicitly
534 * set its frequency to every VSync. Avoiding to write it twice seems to
535 * be enough to solve the problem, but being defensive shouldn't hurt us
536 * either. */
537 val |= VIDEO_DIP_SELECT_AVI | VIDEO_DIP_FREQ_VSYNC;
538
539 if (!enable) {
540 if (!(val & VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE))
541 return;
542 if (port != (val & VIDEO_DIP_PORT_MASK)) {
543 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("video DIP still enabled on port %c\n",
544 (val & VIDEO_DIP_PORT_MASK) >> 29);
545 return;
546 }
547 val &= ~(VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE | VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_AVI |
548 VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_VENDOR | VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_SPD);
549 I915_WRITE(reg, val);
550 POSTING_READ(reg);
551 return;
552 }
553
554 if (port != (val & VIDEO_DIP_PORT_MASK)) {
555 if (val & VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE) {
556 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("video DIP already enabled on port %c\n",
557 (val & VIDEO_DIP_PORT_MASK) >> 29);
558 return;
559 }
560 val &= ~VIDEO_DIP_PORT_MASK;
561 val |= port;
562 }
563
564 val |= VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE;
565 val &= ~(VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_AVI |
566 VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_VENDOR | VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_SPD);
567
568 I915_WRITE(reg, val);
569 POSTING_READ(reg);
570
571 intel_hdmi_set_avi_infoframe(encoder, adjusted_mode);
572 intel_hdmi_set_spd_infoframe(encoder);
573 intel_hdmi_set_hdmi_infoframe(encoder, adjusted_mode);
574}
575
576static bool hdmi_sink_is_deep_color(struct drm_encoder *encoder)
577{
578 struct drm_device *dev = encoder->dev;
579 struct drm_connector *connector;
580
581 WARN_ON(!drm_modeset_is_locked(&dev->mode_config.connection_mutex));
582
583 /*
584 * HDMI cloning is only supported on g4x which doesn't
585 * support deep color or GCP infoframes anyway so no
586 * need to worry about multiple HDMI sinks here.
587 */
588 list_for_each_entry(connector, &dev->mode_config.connector_list, head)
589 if (connector->encoder == encoder)
590 return connector->display_info.bpc > 8;
591
592 return false;
593}
594
595/*
596 * Determine if default_phase=1 can be indicated in the GCP infoframe.
597 *
598 * From HDMI specification 1.4a:
599 * - The first pixel of each Video Data Period shall always have a pixel packing phase of 0
600 * - The first pixel following each Video Data Period shall have a pixel packing phase of 0
601 * - The PP bits shall be constant for all GCPs and will be equal to the last packing phase
602 * - The first pixel following every transition of HSYNC or VSYNC shall have a pixel packing
603 * phase of 0
604 */
605static bool gcp_default_phase_possible(int pipe_bpp,
606 const struct drm_display_mode *mode)
607{
608 unsigned int pixels_per_group;
609
610 switch (pipe_bpp) {
611 case 30:
612 /* 4 pixels in 5 clocks */
613 pixels_per_group = 4;
614 break;
615 case 36:
616 /* 2 pixels in 3 clocks */
617 pixels_per_group = 2;
618 break;
619 case 48:
620 /* 1 pixel in 2 clocks */
621 pixels_per_group = 1;
622 break;
623 default:
624 /* phase information not relevant for 8bpc */
625 return false;
626 }
627
628 return mode->crtc_hdisplay % pixels_per_group == 0 &&
629 mode->crtc_htotal % pixels_per_group == 0 &&
630 mode->crtc_hblank_start % pixels_per_group == 0 &&
631 mode->crtc_hblank_end % pixels_per_group == 0 &&
632 mode->crtc_hsync_start % pixels_per_group == 0 &&
633 mode->crtc_hsync_end % pixels_per_group == 0 &&
634 ((mode->flags & DRM_MODE_FLAG_INTERLACE) == 0 ||
635 mode->crtc_htotal/2 % pixels_per_group == 0);
636}
637
638static bool intel_hdmi_set_gcp_infoframe(struct drm_encoder *encoder)
639{
640 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = encoder->dev->dev_private;
641 struct intel_crtc *crtc = to_intel_crtc(encoder->crtc);
642 u32 reg, val = 0;
643
644 if (HAS_DDI(dev_priv))
645 reg = HSW_TVIDEO_DIP_GCP(crtc->config->cpu_transcoder);
646 else if (IS_VALLEYVIEW(dev_priv))
647 reg = VLV_TVIDEO_DIP_GCP(crtc->pipe);
648 else if (HAS_PCH_SPLIT(dev_priv->dev))
649 reg = TVIDEO_DIP_GCP(crtc->pipe);
650 else
651 return false;
652
653 /* Indicate color depth whenever the sink supports deep color */
654 if (hdmi_sink_is_deep_color(encoder))
655 val |= GCP_COLOR_INDICATION;
656
657 /* Enable default_phase whenever the display mode is suitably aligned */
658 if (gcp_default_phase_possible(crtc->config->pipe_bpp,
659 &crtc->config->base.adjusted_mode))
660 val |= GCP_DEFAULT_PHASE_ENABLE;
661
662 I915_WRITE(reg, val);
663
664 return val != 0;
665}
666
667static void ibx_set_infoframes(struct drm_encoder *encoder,
668 bool enable,
669 const struct drm_display_mode *adjusted_mode)
670{
671 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = encoder->dev->dev_private;
672 struct intel_crtc *intel_crtc = to_intel_crtc(encoder->crtc);
673 struct intel_digital_port *intel_dig_port = enc_to_dig_port(encoder);
674 struct intel_hdmi *intel_hdmi = &intel_dig_port->hdmi;
675 u32 reg = TVIDEO_DIP_CTL(intel_crtc->pipe);
676 u32 val = I915_READ(reg);
677 u32 port = VIDEO_DIP_PORT(intel_dig_port->port);
678
679 assert_hdmi_port_disabled(intel_hdmi);
680
681 /* See the big comment in g4x_set_infoframes() */
682 val |= VIDEO_DIP_SELECT_AVI | VIDEO_DIP_FREQ_VSYNC;
683
684 if (!enable) {
685 if (!(val & VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE))
686 return;
687 val &= ~(VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE | VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_AVI |
688 VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_VENDOR | VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_GAMUT |
689 VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_SPD | VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_GCP);
690 I915_WRITE(reg, val);
691 POSTING_READ(reg);
692 return;
693 }
694
695 if (port != (val & VIDEO_DIP_PORT_MASK)) {
696 WARN(val & VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE,
697 "DIP already enabled on port %c\n",
698 (val & VIDEO_DIP_PORT_MASK) >> 29);
699 val &= ~VIDEO_DIP_PORT_MASK;
700 val |= port;
701 }
702
703 val |= VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE;
704 val &= ~(VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_AVI |
705 VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_VENDOR | VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_GAMUT |
706 VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_SPD | VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_GCP);
707
708 if (intel_hdmi_set_gcp_infoframe(encoder))
709 val |= VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_GCP;
710
711 I915_WRITE(reg, val);
712 POSTING_READ(reg);
713
714 intel_hdmi_set_avi_infoframe(encoder, adjusted_mode);
715 intel_hdmi_set_spd_infoframe(encoder);
716 intel_hdmi_set_hdmi_infoframe(encoder, adjusted_mode);
717}
718
719static void cpt_set_infoframes(struct drm_encoder *encoder,
720 bool enable,
721 const struct drm_display_mode *adjusted_mode)
722{
723 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = encoder->dev->dev_private;
724 struct intel_crtc *intel_crtc = to_intel_crtc(encoder->crtc);
725 struct intel_hdmi *intel_hdmi = enc_to_intel_hdmi(encoder);
726 u32 reg = TVIDEO_DIP_CTL(intel_crtc->pipe);
727 u32 val = I915_READ(reg);
728
729 assert_hdmi_port_disabled(intel_hdmi);
730
731 /* See the big comment in g4x_set_infoframes() */
732 val |= VIDEO_DIP_SELECT_AVI | VIDEO_DIP_FREQ_VSYNC;
733
734 if (!enable) {
735 if (!(val & VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE))
736 return;
737 val &= ~(VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE | VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_AVI |
738 VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_VENDOR | VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_GAMUT |
739 VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_SPD | VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_GCP);
740 I915_WRITE(reg, val);
741 POSTING_READ(reg);
742 return;
743 }
744
745 /* Set both together, unset both together: see the spec. */
746 val |= VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE | VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_AVI;
747 val &= ~(VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_VENDOR | VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_GAMUT |
748 VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_SPD | VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_GCP);
749
750 if (intel_hdmi_set_gcp_infoframe(encoder))
751 val |= VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_GCP;
752
753 I915_WRITE(reg, val);
754 POSTING_READ(reg);
755
756 intel_hdmi_set_avi_infoframe(encoder, adjusted_mode);
757 intel_hdmi_set_spd_infoframe(encoder);
758 intel_hdmi_set_hdmi_infoframe(encoder, adjusted_mode);
759}
760
761static void vlv_set_infoframes(struct drm_encoder *encoder,
762 bool enable,
763 const struct drm_display_mode *adjusted_mode)
764{
765 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = encoder->dev->dev_private;
766 struct intel_digital_port *intel_dig_port = enc_to_dig_port(encoder);
767 struct intel_crtc *intel_crtc = to_intel_crtc(encoder->crtc);
768 struct intel_hdmi *intel_hdmi = enc_to_intel_hdmi(encoder);
769 u32 reg = VLV_TVIDEO_DIP_CTL(intel_crtc->pipe);
770 u32 val = I915_READ(reg);
771 u32 port = VIDEO_DIP_PORT(intel_dig_port->port);
772
773 assert_hdmi_port_disabled(intel_hdmi);
774
775 /* See the big comment in g4x_set_infoframes() */
776 val |= VIDEO_DIP_SELECT_AVI | VIDEO_DIP_FREQ_VSYNC;
777
778 if (!enable) {
779 if (!(val & VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE))
780 return;
781 val &= ~(VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE | VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_AVI |
782 VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_VENDOR | VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_GAMUT |
783 VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_SPD | VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_GCP);
784 I915_WRITE(reg, val);
785 POSTING_READ(reg);
786 return;
787 }
788
789 if (port != (val & VIDEO_DIP_PORT_MASK)) {
790 WARN(val & VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE,
791 "DIP already enabled on port %c\n",
792 (val & VIDEO_DIP_PORT_MASK) >> 29);
793 val &= ~VIDEO_DIP_PORT_MASK;
794 val |= port;
795 }
796
797 val |= VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE;
798 val &= ~(VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_AVI |
799 VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_VENDOR | VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_GAMUT |
800 VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_SPD | VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_GCP);
801
802 if (intel_hdmi_set_gcp_infoframe(encoder))
803 val |= VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_GCP;
804
805 I915_WRITE(reg, val);
806 POSTING_READ(reg);
807
808 intel_hdmi_set_avi_infoframe(encoder, adjusted_mode);
809 intel_hdmi_set_spd_infoframe(encoder);
810 intel_hdmi_set_hdmi_infoframe(encoder, adjusted_mode);
811}
812
813static void hsw_set_infoframes(struct drm_encoder *encoder,
814 bool enable,
815 const struct drm_display_mode *adjusted_mode)
816{
817 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = encoder->dev->dev_private;
818 struct intel_crtc *intel_crtc = to_intel_crtc(encoder->crtc);
819 struct intel_hdmi *intel_hdmi = enc_to_intel_hdmi(encoder);
820 u32 reg = HSW_TVIDEO_DIP_CTL(intel_crtc->config->cpu_transcoder);
821 u32 val = I915_READ(reg);
822
823 assert_hdmi_port_disabled(intel_hdmi);
824
825 val &= ~(VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_VSC_HSW | VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_AVI_HSW |
826 VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_GCP_HSW | VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_VS_HSW |
827 VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_GMP_HSW | VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_SPD_HSW);
828
829 if (!enable) {
830 I915_WRITE(reg, val);
831 POSTING_READ(reg);
832 return;
833 }
834
835 if (intel_hdmi_set_gcp_infoframe(encoder))
836 val |= VIDEO_DIP_ENABLE_GCP_HSW;
837
838 I915_WRITE(reg, val);
839 POSTING_READ(reg);
840
841 intel_hdmi_set_avi_infoframe(encoder, adjusted_mode);
842 intel_hdmi_set_spd_infoframe(encoder);
843 intel_hdmi_set_hdmi_infoframe(encoder, adjusted_mode);
844}
845
846static void intel_hdmi_prepare(struct intel_encoder *encoder)
847{
848 struct drm_device *dev = encoder->base.dev;
849 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
850 struct intel_crtc *crtc = to_intel_crtc(encoder->base.crtc);
851 struct intel_hdmi *intel_hdmi = enc_to_intel_hdmi(&encoder->base);
852 const struct drm_display_mode *adjusted_mode = &crtc->config->base.adjusted_mode;
853 u32 hdmi_val;
854
855 hdmi_val = SDVO_ENCODING_HDMI;
856 if (!HAS_PCH_SPLIT(dev) && crtc->config->limited_color_range)
857 hdmi_val |= HDMI_COLOR_RANGE_16_235;
858 if (adjusted_mode->flags & DRM_MODE_FLAG_PVSYNC)
859 hdmi_val |= SDVO_VSYNC_ACTIVE_HIGH;
860 if (adjusted_mode->flags & DRM_MODE_FLAG_PHSYNC)
861 hdmi_val |= SDVO_HSYNC_ACTIVE_HIGH;
862
863 if (crtc->config->pipe_bpp > 24)
864 hdmi_val |= HDMI_COLOR_FORMAT_12bpc;
865 else
866 hdmi_val |= SDVO_COLOR_FORMAT_8bpc;
867
868 if (crtc->config->has_hdmi_sink)
869 hdmi_val |= HDMI_MODE_SELECT_HDMI;
870
871 if (HAS_PCH_CPT(dev))
872 hdmi_val |= SDVO_PIPE_SEL_CPT(crtc->pipe);
873 else if (IS_CHERRYVIEW(dev))
874 hdmi_val |= SDVO_PIPE_SEL_CHV(crtc->pipe);
875 else
876 hdmi_val |= SDVO_PIPE_SEL(crtc->pipe);
877
878 I915_WRITE(intel_hdmi->hdmi_reg, hdmi_val);
879 POSTING_READ(intel_hdmi->hdmi_reg);
880}
881
882static bool intel_hdmi_get_hw_state(struct intel_encoder *encoder,
883 enum i915_pipe *pipe)
884{
885 struct drm_device *dev = encoder->base.dev;
886 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
887 struct intel_hdmi *intel_hdmi = enc_to_intel_hdmi(&encoder->base);
888 enum intel_display_power_domain power_domain;
889 u32 tmp;
890
891 power_domain = intel_display_port_power_domain(encoder);
892 if (!intel_display_power_is_enabled(dev_priv, power_domain))
893 return false;
894
895 tmp = I915_READ(intel_hdmi->hdmi_reg);
896
897 if (!(tmp & SDVO_ENABLE))
898 return false;
899
900 if (HAS_PCH_CPT(dev))
901 *pipe = PORT_TO_PIPE_CPT(tmp);
902 else if (IS_CHERRYVIEW(dev))
903 *pipe = SDVO_PORT_TO_PIPE_CHV(tmp);
904 else
905 *pipe = PORT_TO_PIPE(tmp);
906
907 return true;
908}
909
910static void intel_hdmi_get_config(struct intel_encoder *encoder,
911 struct intel_crtc_state *pipe_config)
912{
913 struct intel_hdmi *intel_hdmi = enc_to_intel_hdmi(&encoder->base);
914 struct drm_device *dev = encoder->base.dev;
915 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
916 u32 tmp, flags = 0;
917 int dotclock;
918
919 tmp = I915_READ(intel_hdmi->hdmi_reg);
920
921 if (tmp & SDVO_HSYNC_ACTIVE_HIGH)
922 flags |= DRM_MODE_FLAG_PHSYNC;
923 else
924 flags |= DRM_MODE_FLAG_NHSYNC;
925
926 if (tmp & SDVO_VSYNC_ACTIVE_HIGH)
927 flags |= DRM_MODE_FLAG_PVSYNC;
928 else
929 flags |= DRM_MODE_FLAG_NVSYNC;
930
931 if (tmp & HDMI_MODE_SELECT_HDMI)
932 pipe_config->has_hdmi_sink = true;
933
934 if (intel_hdmi->infoframe_enabled(&encoder->base))
935 pipe_config->has_infoframe = true;
936
937 if (tmp & SDVO_AUDIO_ENABLE)
938 pipe_config->has_audio = true;
939
940 if (!HAS_PCH_SPLIT(dev) &&
941 tmp & HDMI_COLOR_RANGE_16_235)
942 pipe_config->limited_color_range = true;
943
944 pipe_config->base.adjusted_mode.flags |= flags;
945
946 if ((tmp & SDVO_COLOR_FORMAT_MASK) == HDMI_COLOR_FORMAT_12bpc)
947 dotclock = pipe_config->port_clock * 2 / 3;
948 else
949 dotclock = pipe_config->port_clock;
950
951 if (pipe_config->pixel_multiplier)
952 dotclock /= pipe_config->pixel_multiplier;
953
954 if (HAS_PCH_SPLIT(dev_priv->dev))
955 ironlake_check_encoder_dotclock(pipe_config, dotclock);
956
957 pipe_config->base.adjusted_mode.crtc_clock = dotclock;
958}
959
960static void intel_enable_hdmi_audio(struct intel_encoder *encoder)
961{
962 struct intel_crtc *crtc = to_intel_crtc(encoder->base.crtc);
963
964 WARN_ON(!crtc->config->has_hdmi_sink);
965 DRM_DEBUG_DRIVER("Enabling HDMI audio on pipe %c\n",
966 pipe_name(crtc->pipe));
967 intel_audio_codec_enable(encoder);
968}
969
970static void g4x_enable_hdmi(struct intel_encoder *encoder)
971{
972 struct drm_device *dev = encoder->base.dev;
973 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
974 struct intel_crtc *crtc = to_intel_crtc(encoder->base.crtc);
975 struct intel_hdmi *intel_hdmi = enc_to_intel_hdmi(&encoder->base);
976 u32 temp;
977
978 temp = I915_READ(intel_hdmi->hdmi_reg);
979
980 temp |= SDVO_ENABLE;
981 if (crtc->config->has_audio)
982 temp |= SDVO_AUDIO_ENABLE;
983
984 I915_WRITE(intel_hdmi->hdmi_reg, temp);
985 POSTING_READ(intel_hdmi->hdmi_reg);
986
987 if (crtc->config->has_audio)
988 intel_enable_hdmi_audio(encoder);
989}
990
991static void ibx_enable_hdmi(struct intel_encoder *encoder)
992{
993 struct drm_device *dev = encoder->base.dev;
994 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
995 struct intel_crtc *crtc = to_intel_crtc(encoder->base.crtc);
996 struct intel_hdmi *intel_hdmi = enc_to_intel_hdmi(&encoder->base);
997 u32 temp;
998
999 temp = I915_READ(intel_hdmi->hdmi_reg);
1000
1001 temp |= SDVO_ENABLE;
1002 if (crtc->config->has_audio)
1003 temp |= SDVO_AUDIO_ENABLE;
1004
1005 /*
1006 * HW workaround, need to write this twice for issue
1007 * that may result in first write getting masked.
1008 */
1009 I915_WRITE(intel_hdmi->hdmi_reg, temp);
1010 POSTING_READ(intel_hdmi->hdmi_reg);
1011 I915_WRITE(intel_hdmi->hdmi_reg, temp);
1012 POSTING_READ(intel_hdmi->hdmi_reg);
1013
1014 /*
1015 * HW workaround, need to toggle enable bit off and on
1016 * for 12bpc with pixel repeat.
1017 *
1018 * FIXME: BSpec says this should be done at the end of
1019 * of the modeset sequence, so not sure if this isn't too soon.
1020 */
1021 if (crtc->config->pipe_bpp > 24 &&
1022 crtc->config->pixel_multiplier > 1) {
1023 I915_WRITE(intel_hdmi->hdmi_reg, temp & ~SDVO_ENABLE);
1024 POSTING_READ(intel_hdmi->hdmi_reg);
1025
1026 /*
1027 * HW workaround, need to write this twice for issue
1028 * that may result in first write getting masked.
1029 */
1030 I915_WRITE(intel_hdmi->hdmi_reg, temp);
1031 POSTING_READ(intel_hdmi->hdmi_reg);
1032 I915_WRITE(intel_hdmi->hdmi_reg, temp);
1033 POSTING_READ(intel_hdmi->hdmi_reg);
1034 }
1035
1036 if (crtc->config->has_audio)
1037 intel_enable_hdmi_audio(encoder);
1038}
1039
1040static void cpt_enable_hdmi(struct intel_encoder *encoder)
1041{
1042 struct drm_device *dev = encoder->base.dev;
1043 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1044 struct intel_crtc *crtc = to_intel_crtc(encoder->base.crtc);
1045 struct intel_hdmi *intel_hdmi = enc_to_intel_hdmi(&encoder->base);
1046 enum i915_pipe pipe = crtc->pipe;
1047 u32 temp;
1048
1049 temp = I915_READ(intel_hdmi->hdmi_reg);
1050
1051 temp |= SDVO_ENABLE;
1052 if (crtc->config->has_audio)
1053 temp |= SDVO_AUDIO_ENABLE;
1054
1055 /*
1056 * WaEnableHDMI8bpcBefore12bpc:snb,ivb
1057 *
1058 * The procedure for 12bpc is as follows:
1059 * 1. disable HDMI clock gating
1060 * 2. enable HDMI with 8bpc
1061 * 3. enable HDMI with 12bpc
1062 * 4. enable HDMI clock gating
1063 */
1064
1065 if (crtc->config->pipe_bpp > 24) {
1066 I915_WRITE(TRANS_CHICKEN1(pipe),
1067 I915_READ(TRANS_CHICKEN1(pipe)) |
1068 TRANS_CHICKEN1_HDMIUNIT_GC_DISABLE);
1069
1070 temp &= ~SDVO_COLOR_FORMAT_MASK;
1071 temp |= SDVO_COLOR_FORMAT_8bpc;
1072 }
1073
1074 I915_WRITE(intel_hdmi->hdmi_reg, temp);
1075 POSTING_READ(intel_hdmi->hdmi_reg);
1076
1077 if (crtc->config->pipe_bpp > 24) {
1078 temp &= ~SDVO_COLOR_FORMAT_MASK;
1079 temp |= HDMI_COLOR_FORMAT_12bpc;
1080
1081 I915_WRITE(intel_hdmi->hdmi_reg, temp);
1082 POSTING_READ(intel_hdmi->hdmi_reg);
1083
1084 I915_WRITE(TRANS_CHICKEN1(pipe),
1085 I915_READ(TRANS_CHICKEN1(pipe)) &
1086 ~TRANS_CHICKEN1_HDMIUNIT_GC_DISABLE);
1087 }
1088
1089 if (crtc->config->has_audio)
1090 intel_enable_hdmi_audio(encoder);
1091}
1092
1093static void vlv_enable_hdmi(struct intel_encoder *encoder)
1094{
1095}
1096
1097static void intel_disable_hdmi(struct intel_encoder *encoder)
1098{
1099 struct drm_device *dev = encoder->base.dev;
1100 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1101 struct intel_hdmi *intel_hdmi = enc_to_intel_hdmi(&encoder->base);
1102 struct intel_crtc *crtc = to_intel_crtc(encoder->base.crtc);
1103 u32 temp;
1104
1105 temp = I915_READ(intel_hdmi->hdmi_reg);
1106
1107 temp &= ~(SDVO_ENABLE | SDVO_AUDIO_ENABLE);
1108 I915_WRITE(intel_hdmi->hdmi_reg, temp);
1109 POSTING_READ(intel_hdmi->hdmi_reg);
1110
1111 /*
1112 * HW workaround for IBX, we need to move the port
1113 * to transcoder A after disabling it to allow the
1114 * matching DP port to be enabled on transcoder A.
1115 */
1116 if (HAS_PCH_IBX(dev) && crtc->pipe == PIPE_B) {
1117 temp &= ~SDVO_PIPE_B_SELECT;
1118 temp |= SDVO_ENABLE;
1119 /*
1120 * HW workaround, need to write this twice for issue
1121 * that may result in first write getting masked.
1122 */
1123 I915_WRITE(intel_hdmi->hdmi_reg, temp);
1124 POSTING_READ(intel_hdmi->hdmi_reg);
1125 I915_WRITE(intel_hdmi->hdmi_reg, temp);
1126 POSTING_READ(intel_hdmi->hdmi_reg);
1127
1128 temp &= ~SDVO_ENABLE;
1129 I915_WRITE(intel_hdmi->hdmi_reg, temp);
1130 POSTING_READ(intel_hdmi->hdmi_reg);
1131 }
1132
1133 intel_hdmi->set_infoframes(&encoder->base, false, NULL);
1134}
1135
1136static void g4x_disable_hdmi(struct intel_encoder *encoder)
1137{
1138 struct intel_crtc *crtc = to_intel_crtc(encoder->base.crtc);
1139
1140 if (crtc->config->has_audio)
1141 intel_audio_codec_disable(encoder);
1142
1143 intel_disable_hdmi(encoder);
1144}
1145
1146static void pch_disable_hdmi(struct intel_encoder *encoder)
1147{
1148 struct intel_crtc *crtc = to_intel_crtc(encoder->base.crtc);
1149
1150 if (crtc->config->has_audio)
1151 intel_audio_codec_disable(encoder);
1152}
1153
1154static void pch_post_disable_hdmi(struct intel_encoder *encoder)
1155{
1156 intel_disable_hdmi(encoder);
1157}
1158
1159static int hdmi_port_clock_limit(struct intel_hdmi *hdmi, bool respect_dvi_limit)
1160{
1161 struct drm_device *dev = intel_hdmi_to_dev(hdmi);
1162
1163 if ((respect_dvi_limit && !hdmi->has_hdmi_sink) || IS_G4X(dev))
1164 return 165000;
1165 else if (IS_HASWELL(dev) || INTEL_INFO(dev)->gen >= 8)
1166 return 300000;
1167 else
1168 return 225000;
1169}
1170
1171static enum drm_mode_status
1172hdmi_port_clock_valid(struct intel_hdmi *hdmi,
1173 int clock, bool respect_dvi_limit)
1174{
1175 struct drm_device *dev = intel_hdmi_to_dev(hdmi);
1176
1177 if (clock < 25000)
1178 return MODE_CLOCK_LOW;
1179 if (clock > hdmi_port_clock_limit(hdmi, respect_dvi_limit))
1180 return MODE_CLOCK_HIGH;
1181
1182 /* BXT DPLL can't generate 223-240 MHz */
1183 if (IS_BROXTON(dev) && clock > 223333 && clock < 240000)
1184 return MODE_CLOCK_RANGE;
1185
1186 /* CHV DPLL can't generate 216-240 MHz */
1187 if (IS_CHERRYVIEW(dev) && clock > 216000 && clock < 240000)
1188 return MODE_CLOCK_RANGE;
1189
1190 return MODE_OK;
1191}
1192
1193static enum drm_mode_status
1194intel_hdmi_mode_valid(struct drm_connector *connector,
1195 struct drm_display_mode *mode)
1196{
1197 struct intel_hdmi *hdmi = intel_attached_hdmi(connector);
1198 struct drm_device *dev = intel_hdmi_to_dev(hdmi);
1199 enum drm_mode_status status;
1200 int clock;
1201
1202 if (mode->flags & DRM_MODE_FLAG_DBLSCAN)
1203 return MODE_NO_DBLESCAN;
1204
1205 clock = mode->clock;
1206 if (mode->flags & DRM_MODE_FLAG_DBLCLK)
1207 clock *= 2;
1208
1209 /* check if we can do 8bpc */
1210 status = hdmi_port_clock_valid(hdmi, clock, true);
1211
1212 /* if we can't do 8bpc we may still be able to do 12bpc */
1213 if (!HAS_GMCH_DISPLAY(dev) && status != MODE_OK)
1214 status = hdmi_port_clock_valid(hdmi, clock * 3 / 2, true);
1215
1216 return status;
1217}
1218
1219static bool hdmi_12bpc_possible(struct intel_crtc_state *crtc_state)
1220{
1221 struct drm_device *dev = crtc_state->base.crtc->dev;
1222 struct drm_atomic_state *state;
1223 struct intel_encoder *encoder;
1224 struct drm_connector *connector;
1225 struct drm_connector_state *connector_state;
1226 int count = 0, count_hdmi = 0;
1227 int i;
1228
1229 if (HAS_GMCH_DISPLAY(dev))
1230 return false;
1231
1232 state = crtc_state->base.state;
1233
1234 for_each_connector_in_state(state, connector, connector_state, i) {
1235 if (connector_state->crtc != crtc_state->base.crtc)
1236 continue;
1237
1238 encoder = to_intel_encoder(connector_state->best_encoder);
1239
1240 count_hdmi += encoder->type == INTEL_OUTPUT_HDMI;
1241 count++;
1242 }
1243
1244 /*
1245 * HDMI 12bpc affects the clocks, so it's only possible
1246 * when not cloning with other encoder types.
1247 */
1248 return count_hdmi > 0 && count_hdmi == count;
1249}
1250
1251bool intel_hdmi_compute_config(struct intel_encoder *encoder,
1252 struct intel_crtc_state *pipe_config)
1253{
1254 struct intel_hdmi *intel_hdmi = enc_to_intel_hdmi(&encoder->base);
1255 struct drm_device *dev = encoder->base.dev;
1256 struct drm_display_mode *adjusted_mode = &pipe_config->base.adjusted_mode;
1257 int clock_8bpc = pipe_config->base.adjusted_mode.crtc_clock;
1258 int clock_12bpc = clock_8bpc * 3 / 2;
1259 int desired_bpp;
1260
1261 pipe_config->has_hdmi_sink = intel_hdmi->has_hdmi_sink;
1262
1263 if (pipe_config->has_hdmi_sink)
1264 pipe_config->has_infoframe = true;
1265
1266 if (intel_hdmi->color_range_auto) {
1267 /* See CEA-861-E - 5.1 Default Encoding Parameters */
1268 pipe_config->limited_color_range =
1269 pipe_config->has_hdmi_sink &&
1270 drm_match_cea_mode(adjusted_mode) > 1;
1271 } else {
1272 pipe_config->limited_color_range =
1273 intel_hdmi->limited_color_range;
1274 }
1275
1276 if (adjusted_mode->flags & DRM_MODE_FLAG_DBLCLK) {
1277 pipe_config->pixel_multiplier = 2;
1278 clock_8bpc *= 2;
1279 clock_12bpc *= 2;
1280 }
1281
1282 if (HAS_PCH_SPLIT(dev) && !HAS_DDI(dev))
1283 pipe_config->has_pch_encoder = true;
1284
1285 if (pipe_config->has_hdmi_sink && intel_hdmi->has_audio)
1286 pipe_config->has_audio = true;
1287
1288 /*
1289 * HDMI is either 12 or 8, so if the display lets 10bpc sneak
1290 * through, clamp it down. Note that g4x/vlv don't support 12bpc hdmi
1291 * outputs. We also need to check that the higher clock still fits
1292 * within limits.
1293 */
1294 if (pipe_config->pipe_bpp > 8*3 && pipe_config->has_hdmi_sink &&
1295 hdmi_port_clock_valid(intel_hdmi, clock_12bpc, false) == MODE_OK &&
1296 hdmi_12bpc_possible(pipe_config)) {
1297 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("picking bpc to 12 for HDMI output\n");
1298 desired_bpp = 12*3;
1299
1300 /* Need to adjust the port link by 1.5x for 12bpc. */
1301 pipe_config->port_clock = clock_12bpc;
1302 } else {
1303 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("picking bpc to 8 for HDMI output\n");
1304 desired_bpp = 8*3;
1305
1306 pipe_config->port_clock = clock_8bpc;
1307 }
1308
1309 if (!pipe_config->bw_constrained) {
1310 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("forcing pipe bpc to %i for HDMI\n", desired_bpp);
1311 pipe_config->pipe_bpp = desired_bpp;
1312 }
1313
1314 if (hdmi_port_clock_valid(intel_hdmi, pipe_config->port_clock,
1315 false) != MODE_OK) {
1316 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("unsupported HDMI clock, rejecting mode\n");
1317 return false;
1318 }
1319
1320 /* Set user selected PAR to incoming mode's member */
1321 adjusted_mode->picture_aspect_ratio = intel_hdmi->aspect_ratio;
1322
1323 return true;
1324}
1325
1326static void
1327intel_hdmi_unset_edid(struct drm_connector *connector)
1328{
1329 struct intel_hdmi *intel_hdmi = intel_attached_hdmi(connector);
1330
1331 intel_hdmi->has_hdmi_sink = false;
1332 intel_hdmi->has_audio = false;
1333 intel_hdmi->rgb_quant_range_selectable = false;
1334
1335 kfree(to_intel_connector(connector)->detect_edid);
1336 to_intel_connector(connector)->detect_edid = NULL;
1337}
1338
1339static bool
1340intel_hdmi_set_edid(struct drm_connector *connector)
1341{
1342 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = to_i915(connector->dev);
1343 struct intel_hdmi *intel_hdmi = intel_attached_hdmi(connector);
1344 struct edid *edid;
1345 bool connected = false;
1346
1347 intel_display_power_get(dev_priv, POWER_DOMAIN_GMBUS);
1348
1349 edid = drm_get_edid(connector,
1350 intel_gmbus_get_adapter(dev_priv,
1351 intel_hdmi->ddc_bus));
1352
1353 intel_display_power_put(dev_priv, POWER_DOMAIN_GMBUS);
1354
1355 to_intel_connector(connector)->detect_edid = edid;
1356 if (edid && edid->input & DRM_EDID_INPUT_DIGITAL) {
1357 intel_hdmi->rgb_quant_range_selectable =
1358 drm_rgb_quant_range_selectable(edid);
1359
1360 intel_hdmi->has_audio = drm_detect_monitor_audio(edid);
1361 if (intel_hdmi->force_audio != HDMI_AUDIO_AUTO)
1362 intel_hdmi->has_audio =
1363 intel_hdmi->force_audio == HDMI_AUDIO_ON;
1364
1365 if (intel_hdmi->force_audio != HDMI_AUDIO_OFF_DVI)
1366 intel_hdmi->has_hdmi_sink =
1367 drm_detect_hdmi_monitor(edid);
1368
1369 connected = true;
1370 }
1371
1372 return connected;
1373}
1374
1375static enum drm_connector_status
1376intel_hdmi_detect(struct drm_connector *connector, bool force)
1377{
1378 enum drm_connector_status status;
1379 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = to_i915(connector->dev);
1380
1381 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("[CONNECTOR:%d:%s]\n",
1382 connector->base.id, connector->name);
1383
1384 intel_display_power_get(dev_priv, POWER_DOMAIN_GMBUS);
1385
1386 intel_hdmi_unset_edid(connector);
1387
1388 if (intel_hdmi_set_edid(connector)) {
1389 struct intel_hdmi *intel_hdmi = intel_attached_hdmi(connector);
1390
1391 hdmi_to_dig_port(intel_hdmi)->base.type = INTEL_OUTPUT_HDMI;
1392 status = connector_status_connected;
1393 } else
1394 status = connector_status_disconnected;
1395
1396 intel_display_power_put(dev_priv, POWER_DOMAIN_GMBUS);
1397
1398 return status;
1399}
1400
1401static void
1402intel_hdmi_force(struct drm_connector *connector)
1403{
1404 struct intel_hdmi *intel_hdmi = intel_attached_hdmi(connector);
1405
1406 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("[CONNECTOR:%d:%s]\n",
1407 connector->base.id, connector->name);
1408
1409 intel_hdmi_unset_edid(connector);
1410
1411 if (connector->status != connector_status_connected)
1412 return;
1413
1414 intel_hdmi_set_edid(connector);
1415 hdmi_to_dig_port(intel_hdmi)->base.type = INTEL_OUTPUT_HDMI;
1416}
1417
1418static int intel_hdmi_get_modes(struct drm_connector *connector)
1419{
1420 struct edid *edid;
1421
1422 edid = to_intel_connector(connector)->detect_edid;
1423 if (edid == NULL)
1424 return 0;
1425
1426 return intel_connector_update_modes(connector, edid);
1427}
1428
1429static bool
1430intel_hdmi_detect_audio(struct drm_connector *connector)
1431{
1432 bool has_audio = false;
1433 struct edid *edid;
1434
1435 edid = to_intel_connector(connector)->detect_edid;
1436 if (edid && edid->input & DRM_EDID_INPUT_DIGITAL)
1437 has_audio = drm_detect_monitor_audio(edid);
1438
1439 return has_audio;
1440}
1441
1442static int
1443intel_hdmi_set_property(struct drm_connector *connector,
1444 struct drm_property *property,
1445 uint64_t val)
1446{
1447 struct intel_hdmi *intel_hdmi = intel_attached_hdmi(connector);
1448 struct intel_digital_port *intel_dig_port =
1449 hdmi_to_dig_port(intel_hdmi);
1450 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = connector->dev->dev_private;
1451 int ret;
1452
1453 ret = drm_object_property_set_value(&connector->base, property, val);
1454 if (ret)
1455 return ret;
1456
1457 if (property == dev_priv->force_audio_property) {
1458 enum hdmi_force_audio i = val;
1459 bool has_audio;
1460
1461 if (i == intel_hdmi->force_audio)
1462 return 0;
1463
1464 intel_hdmi->force_audio = i;
1465
1466 if (i == HDMI_AUDIO_AUTO)
1467 has_audio = intel_hdmi_detect_audio(connector);
1468 else
1469 has_audio = (i == HDMI_AUDIO_ON);
1470
1471 if (i == HDMI_AUDIO_OFF_DVI)
1472 intel_hdmi->has_hdmi_sink = 0;
1473
1474 intel_hdmi->has_audio = has_audio;
1475 goto done;
1476 }
1477
1478 if (property == dev_priv->broadcast_rgb_property) {
1479 bool old_auto = intel_hdmi->color_range_auto;
1480 bool old_range = intel_hdmi->limited_color_range;
1481
1482 switch (val) {
1483 case INTEL_BROADCAST_RGB_AUTO:
1484 intel_hdmi->color_range_auto = true;
1485 break;
1486 case INTEL_BROADCAST_RGB_FULL:
1487 intel_hdmi->color_range_auto = false;
1488 intel_hdmi->limited_color_range = false;
1489 break;
1490 case INTEL_BROADCAST_RGB_LIMITED:
1491 intel_hdmi->color_range_auto = false;
1492 intel_hdmi->limited_color_range = true;
1493 break;
1494 default:
1495 return -EINVAL;
1496 }
1497
1498 if (old_auto == intel_hdmi->color_range_auto &&
1499 old_range == intel_hdmi->limited_color_range)
1500 return 0;
1501
1502 goto done;
1503 }
1504
1505 if (property == connector->dev->mode_config.aspect_ratio_property) {
1506 switch (val) {
1507 case DRM_MODE_PICTURE_ASPECT_NONE:
1508 intel_hdmi->aspect_ratio = HDMI_PICTURE_ASPECT_NONE;
1509 break;
1510 case DRM_MODE_PICTURE_ASPECT_4_3:
1511 intel_hdmi->aspect_ratio = HDMI_PICTURE_ASPECT_4_3;
1512 break;
1513 case DRM_MODE_PICTURE_ASPECT_16_9:
1514 intel_hdmi->aspect_ratio = HDMI_PICTURE_ASPECT_16_9;
1515 break;
1516 default:
1517 return -EINVAL;
1518 }
1519 goto done;
1520 }
1521
1522 return -EINVAL;
1523
1524done:
1525 if (intel_dig_port->base.base.crtc)
1526 intel_crtc_restore_mode(intel_dig_port->base.base.crtc);
1527
1528 return 0;
1529}
1530
1531static void intel_hdmi_pre_enable(struct intel_encoder *encoder)
1532{
1533 struct intel_hdmi *intel_hdmi = enc_to_intel_hdmi(&encoder->base);
1534 struct intel_crtc *intel_crtc = to_intel_crtc(encoder->base.crtc);
1535 const struct drm_display_mode *adjusted_mode = &intel_crtc->config->base.adjusted_mode;
1536
1537 intel_hdmi_prepare(encoder);
1538
1539 intel_hdmi->set_infoframes(&encoder->base,
1540 intel_crtc->config->has_hdmi_sink,
1541 adjusted_mode);
1542}
1543
1544static void vlv_hdmi_pre_enable(struct intel_encoder *encoder)
1545{
1546 struct intel_digital_port *dport = enc_to_dig_port(&encoder->base);
1547 struct intel_hdmi *intel_hdmi = &dport->hdmi;
1548 struct drm_device *dev = encoder->base.dev;
1549 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1550 struct intel_crtc *intel_crtc =
1551 to_intel_crtc(encoder->base.crtc);
1552 const struct drm_display_mode *adjusted_mode = &intel_crtc->config->base.adjusted_mode;
1553 enum dpio_channel port = vlv_dport_to_channel(dport);
1554 int pipe = intel_crtc->pipe;
1555 u32 val;
1556
1557 /* Enable clock channels for this port */
1558 mutex_lock(&dev_priv->sb_lock);
1559 val = vlv_dpio_read(dev_priv, pipe, VLV_PCS01_DW8(port));
1560 val = 0;
1561 if (pipe)
1562 val |= (1<<21);
1563 else
1564 val &= ~(1<<21);
1565 val |= 0x001000c4;
1566 vlv_dpio_write(dev_priv, pipe, VLV_PCS_DW8(port), val);
1567
1568 /* HDMI 1.0V-2dB */
1569 vlv_dpio_write(dev_priv, pipe, VLV_TX_DW5(port), 0);
1570 vlv_dpio_write(dev_priv, pipe, VLV_TX_DW4(port), 0x2b245f5f);
1571 vlv_dpio_write(dev_priv, pipe, VLV_TX_DW2(port), 0x5578b83a);
1572 vlv_dpio_write(dev_priv, pipe, VLV_TX_DW3(port), 0x0c782040);
1573 vlv_dpio_write(dev_priv, pipe, VLV_TX3_DW4(port), 0x2b247878);
1574 vlv_dpio_write(dev_priv, pipe, VLV_PCS_DW11(port), 0x00030000);
1575 vlv_dpio_write(dev_priv, pipe, VLV_PCS_DW9(port), 0x00002000);
1576 vlv_dpio_write(dev_priv, pipe, VLV_TX_DW5(port), DPIO_TX_OCALINIT_EN);
1577
1578 /* Program lane clock */
1579 vlv_dpio_write(dev_priv, pipe, VLV_PCS_DW14(port), 0x00760018);
1580 vlv_dpio_write(dev_priv, pipe, VLV_PCS_DW23(port), 0x00400888);
1581 mutex_unlock(&dev_priv->sb_lock);
1582
1583 intel_hdmi->set_infoframes(&encoder->base,
1584 intel_crtc->config->has_hdmi_sink,
1585 adjusted_mode);
1586
1587 g4x_enable_hdmi(encoder);
1588
1589 vlv_wait_port_ready(dev_priv, dport, 0x0);
1590}
1591
1592static void vlv_hdmi_pre_pll_enable(struct intel_encoder *encoder)
1593{
1594 struct intel_digital_port *dport = enc_to_dig_port(&encoder->base);
1595 struct drm_device *dev = encoder->base.dev;
1596 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1597 struct intel_crtc *intel_crtc =
1598 to_intel_crtc(encoder->base.crtc);
1599 enum dpio_channel port = vlv_dport_to_channel(dport);
1600 int pipe = intel_crtc->pipe;
1601
1602 intel_hdmi_prepare(encoder);
1603
1604 /* Program Tx lane resets to default */
1605 mutex_lock(&dev_priv->sb_lock);
1606 vlv_dpio_write(dev_priv, pipe, VLV_PCS_DW0(port),
1607 DPIO_PCS_TX_LANE2_RESET |
1608 DPIO_PCS_TX_LANE1_RESET);
1609 vlv_dpio_write(dev_priv, pipe, VLV_PCS_DW1(port),
1610 DPIO_PCS_CLK_CRI_RXEB_EIOS_EN |
1611 DPIO_PCS_CLK_CRI_RXDIGFILTSG_EN |
1612 (1<<DPIO_PCS_CLK_DATAWIDTH_SHIFT) |
1613 DPIO_PCS_CLK_SOFT_RESET);
1614
1615 /* Fix up inter-pair skew failure */
1616 vlv_dpio_write(dev_priv, pipe, VLV_PCS_DW12(port), 0x00750f00);
1617 vlv_dpio_write(dev_priv, pipe, VLV_TX_DW11(port), 0x00001500);
1618 vlv_dpio_write(dev_priv, pipe, VLV_TX_DW14(port), 0x40400000);
1619
1620 vlv_dpio_write(dev_priv, pipe, VLV_PCS_DW9(port), 0x00002000);
1621 vlv_dpio_write(dev_priv, pipe, VLV_TX_DW5(port), DPIO_TX_OCALINIT_EN);
1622 mutex_unlock(&dev_priv->sb_lock);
1623}
1624
1625static void chv_data_lane_soft_reset(struct intel_encoder *encoder,
1626 bool reset)
1627{
1628 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = to_i915(encoder->base.dev);
1629 enum dpio_channel ch = vlv_dport_to_channel(enc_to_dig_port(&encoder->base));
1630 struct intel_crtc *crtc = to_intel_crtc(encoder->base.crtc);
1631 enum i915_pipe pipe = crtc->pipe;
1632 uint32_t val;
1633
1634 val = vlv_dpio_read(dev_priv, pipe, VLV_PCS01_DW0(ch));
1635 if (reset)
1636 val &= ~(DPIO_PCS_TX_LANE2_RESET | DPIO_PCS_TX_LANE1_RESET);
1637 else
1638 val |= DPIO_PCS_TX_LANE2_RESET | DPIO_PCS_TX_LANE1_RESET;
1639 vlv_dpio_write(dev_priv, pipe, VLV_PCS01_DW0(ch), val);
1640
1641 if (crtc->config->lane_count > 2) {
1642 val = vlv_dpio_read(dev_priv, pipe, VLV_PCS23_DW0(ch));
1643 if (reset)
1644 val &= ~(DPIO_PCS_TX_LANE2_RESET | DPIO_PCS_TX_LANE1_RESET);
1645 else
1646 val |= DPIO_PCS_TX_LANE2_RESET | DPIO_PCS_TX_LANE1_RESET;
1647 vlv_dpio_write(dev_priv, pipe, VLV_PCS23_DW0(ch), val);
1648 }
1649
1650 val = vlv_dpio_read(dev_priv, pipe, VLV_PCS01_DW1(ch));
1651 val |= CHV_PCS_REQ_SOFTRESET_EN;
1652 if (reset)
1653 val &= ~DPIO_PCS_CLK_SOFT_RESET;
1654 else
1655 val |= DPIO_PCS_CLK_SOFT_RESET;
1656 vlv_dpio_write(dev_priv, pipe, VLV_PCS01_DW1(ch), val);
1657
1658 if (crtc->config->lane_count > 2) {
1659 val = vlv_dpio_read(dev_priv, pipe, VLV_PCS23_DW1(ch));
1660 val |= CHV_PCS_REQ_SOFTRESET_EN;
1661 if (reset)
1662 val &= ~DPIO_PCS_CLK_SOFT_RESET;
1663 else
1664 val |= DPIO_PCS_CLK_SOFT_RESET;
1665 vlv_dpio_write(dev_priv, pipe, VLV_PCS23_DW1(ch), val);
1666 }
1667}
1668
1669static void chv_hdmi_pre_pll_enable(struct intel_encoder *encoder)
1670{
1671 struct intel_digital_port *dport = enc_to_dig_port(&encoder->base);
1672 struct drm_device *dev = encoder->base.dev;
1673 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1674 struct intel_crtc *intel_crtc =
1675 to_intel_crtc(encoder->base.crtc);
1676 enum dpio_channel ch = vlv_dport_to_channel(dport);
1677 enum i915_pipe pipe = intel_crtc->pipe;
1678 u32 val;
1679
1680 intel_hdmi_prepare(encoder);
1681
1682 /*
1683 * Must trick the second common lane into life.
1684 * Otherwise we can't even access the PLL.
1685 */
1686 if (ch == DPIO_CH0 && pipe == PIPE_B)
1687 dport->release_cl2_override =
1688 !chv_phy_powergate_ch(dev_priv, DPIO_PHY0, DPIO_CH1, true);
1689
1690 chv_phy_powergate_lanes(encoder, true, 0x0);
1691
1692 mutex_lock(&dev_priv->sb_lock);
1693
1694 /* Assert data lane reset */
1695 chv_data_lane_soft_reset(encoder, true);
1696
1697 /* program left/right clock distribution */
1698 if (pipe != PIPE_B) {
1699 val = vlv_dpio_read(dev_priv, pipe, _CHV_CMN_DW5_CH0);
1700 val &= ~(CHV_BUFLEFTENA1_MASK | CHV_BUFRIGHTENA1_MASK);
1701 if (ch == DPIO_CH0)
1702 val |= CHV_BUFLEFTENA1_FORCE;
1703 if (ch == DPIO_CH1)
1704 val |= CHV_BUFRIGHTENA1_FORCE;
1705 vlv_dpio_write(dev_priv, pipe, _CHV_CMN_DW5_CH0, val);
1706 } else {
1707 val = vlv_dpio_read(dev_priv, pipe, _CHV_CMN_DW1_CH1);
1708 val &= ~(CHV_BUFLEFTENA2_MASK | CHV_BUFRIGHTENA2_MASK);
1709 if (ch == DPIO_CH0)
1710 val |= CHV_BUFLEFTENA2_FORCE;
1711 if (ch == DPIO_CH1)
1712 val |= CHV_BUFRIGHTENA2_FORCE;
1713 vlv_dpio_write(dev_priv, pipe, _CHV_CMN_DW1_CH1, val);
1714 }
1715
1716 /* program clock channel usage */
1717 val = vlv_dpio_read(dev_priv, pipe, VLV_PCS01_DW8(ch));
1718 val |= CHV_PCS_USEDCLKCHANNEL_OVRRIDE;
1719 if (pipe != PIPE_B)
1720 val &= ~CHV_PCS_USEDCLKCHANNEL;
1721 else
1722 val |= CHV_PCS_USEDCLKCHANNEL;
1723 vlv_dpio_write(dev_priv, pipe, VLV_PCS01_DW8(ch), val);
1724
1725 val = vlv_dpio_read(dev_priv, pipe, VLV_PCS23_DW8(ch));
1726 val |= CHV_PCS_USEDCLKCHANNEL_OVRRIDE;
1727 if (pipe != PIPE_B)
1728 val &= ~CHV_PCS_USEDCLKCHANNEL;
1729 else
1730 val |= CHV_PCS_USEDCLKCHANNEL;
1731 vlv_dpio_write(dev_priv, pipe, VLV_PCS23_DW8(ch), val);
1732
1733 /*
1734 * This a a bit weird since generally CL
1735 * matches the pipe, but here we need to
1736 * pick the CL based on the port.
1737 */
1738 val = vlv_dpio_read(dev_priv, pipe, CHV_CMN_DW19(ch));
1739 if (pipe != PIPE_B)
1740 val &= ~CHV_CMN_USEDCLKCHANNEL;
1741 else
1742 val |= CHV_CMN_USEDCLKCHANNEL;
1743 vlv_dpio_write(dev_priv, pipe, CHV_CMN_DW19(ch), val);
1744
1745 mutex_unlock(&dev_priv->sb_lock);
1746}
1747
1748static void chv_hdmi_post_pll_disable(struct intel_encoder *encoder)
1749{
1750 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = to_i915(encoder->base.dev);
1751 enum i915_pipe pipe = to_intel_crtc(encoder->base.crtc)->pipe;
1752 u32 val;
1753
1754 mutex_lock(&dev_priv->sb_lock);
1755
1756 /* disable left/right clock distribution */
1757 if (pipe != PIPE_B) {
1758 val = vlv_dpio_read(dev_priv, pipe, _CHV_CMN_DW5_CH0);
1759 val &= ~(CHV_BUFLEFTENA1_MASK | CHV_BUFRIGHTENA1_MASK);
1760 vlv_dpio_write(dev_priv, pipe, _CHV_CMN_DW5_CH0, val);
1761 } else {
1762 val = vlv_dpio_read(dev_priv, pipe, _CHV_CMN_DW1_CH1);
1763 val &= ~(CHV_BUFLEFTENA2_MASK | CHV_BUFRIGHTENA2_MASK);
1764 vlv_dpio_write(dev_priv, pipe, _CHV_CMN_DW1_CH1, val);
1765 }
1766
1767 mutex_unlock(&dev_priv->sb_lock);
1768
1769 /*
1770 * Leave the power down bit cleared for at least one
1771 * lane so that chv_powergate_phy_ch() will power
1772 * on something when the channel is otherwise unused.
1773 * When the port is off and the override is removed
1774 * the lanes power down anyway, so otherwise it doesn't
1775 * really matter what the state of power down bits is
1776 * after this.
1777 */
1778 chv_phy_powergate_lanes(encoder, false, 0x0);
1779}
1780
1781static void vlv_hdmi_post_disable(struct intel_encoder *encoder)
1782{
1783 struct intel_digital_port *dport = enc_to_dig_port(&encoder->base);
1784 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = encoder->base.dev->dev_private;
1785 struct intel_crtc *intel_crtc =
1786 to_intel_crtc(encoder->base.crtc);
1787 enum dpio_channel port = vlv_dport_to_channel(dport);
1788 int pipe = intel_crtc->pipe;
1789
1790 /* Reset lanes to avoid HDMI flicker (VLV w/a) */
1791 mutex_lock(&dev_priv->sb_lock);
1792 vlv_dpio_write(dev_priv, pipe, VLV_PCS_DW0(port), 0x00000000);
1793 vlv_dpio_write(dev_priv, pipe, VLV_PCS_DW1(port), 0x00e00060);
1794 mutex_unlock(&dev_priv->sb_lock);
1795}
1796
1797static void chv_hdmi_post_disable(struct intel_encoder *encoder)
1798{
1799 struct drm_device *dev = encoder->base.dev;
1800 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1801
1802 mutex_lock(&dev_priv->sb_lock);
1803
1804 /* Assert data lane reset */
1805 chv_data_lane_soft_reset(encoder, true);
1806
1807 mutex_unlock(&dev_priv->sb_lock);
1808}
1809
1810static void chv_hdmi_pre_enable(struct intel_encoder *encoder)
1811{
1812 struct intel_digital_port *dport = enc_to_dig_port(&encoder->base);
1813 struct intel_hdmi *intel_hdmi = &dport->hdmi;
1814 struct drm_device *dev = encoder->base.dev;
1815 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
1816 struct intel_crtc *intel_crtc =
1817 to_intel_crtc(encoder->base.crtc);
1818 const struct drm_display_mode *adjusted_mode = &intel_crtc->config->base.adjusted_mode;
1819 enum dpio_channel ch = vlv_dport_to_channel(dport);
1820 int pipe = intel_crtc->pipe;
1821 int data, i, stagger;
1822 u32 val;
1823
1824 mutex_lock(&dev_priv->sb_lock);
1825
1826 /* allow hardware to manage TX FIFO reset source */
1827 val = vlv_dpio_read(dev_priv, pipe, VLV_PCS01_DW11(ch));
1828 val &= ~DPIO_LANEDESKEW_STRAP_OVRD;
1829 vlv_dpio_write(dev_priv, pipe, VLV_PCS01_DW11(ch), val);
1830
1831 val = vlv_dpio_read(dev_priv, pipe, VLV_PCS23_DW11(ch));
1832 val &= ~DPIO_LANEDESKEW_STRAP_OVRD;
1833 vlv_dpio_write(dev_priv, pipe, VLV_PCS23_DW11(ch), val);
1834
1835 /* Program Tx latency optimal setting */
1836 for (i = 0; i < 4; i++) {
1837 /* Set the upar bit */
1838 data = (i == 1) ? 0x0 : 0x1;
1839 vlv_dpio_write(dev_priv, pipe, CHV_TX_DW14(ch, i),
1840 data << DPIO_UPAR_SHIFT);
1841 }
1842
1843 /* Data lane stagger programming */
1844 if (intel_crtc->config->port_clock > 270000)
1845 stagger = 0x18;
1846 else if (intel_crtc->config->port_clock > 135000)
1847 stagger = 0xd;
1848 else if (intel_crtc->config->port_clock > 67500)
1849 stagger = 0x7;
1850 else if (intel_crtc->config->port_clock > 33750)
1851 stagger = 0x4;
1852 else
1853 stagger = 0x2;
1854
1855 val = vlv_dpio_read(dev_priv, pipe, VLV_PCS01_DW11(ch));
1856 val |= DPIO_TX2_STAGGER_MASK(0x1f);
1857 vlv_dpio_write(dev_priv, pipe, VLV_PCS01_DW11(ch), val);
1858
1859 val = vlv_dpio_read(dev_priv, pipe, VLV_PCS23_DW11(ch));
1860 val |= DPIO_TX2_STAGGER_MASK(0x1f);
1861 vlv_dpio_write(dev_priv, pipe, VLV_PCS23_DW11(ch), val);
1862
1863 vlv_dpio_write(dev_priv, pipe, VLV_PCS01_DW12(ch),
1864 DPIO_LANESTAGGER_STRAP(stagger) |
1865 DPIO_LANESTAGGER_STRAP_OVRD |
1866 DPIO_TX1_STAGGER_MASK(0x1f) |
1867 DPIO_TX1_STAGGER_MULT(6) |
1868 DPIO_TX2_STAGGER_MULT(0));
1869
1870 vlv_dpio_write(dev_priv, pipe, VLV_PCS23_DW12(ch),
1871 DPIO_LANESTAGGER_STRAP(stagger) |
1872 DPIO_LANESTAGGER_STRAP_OVRD |
1873 DPIO_TX1_STAGGER_MASK(0x1f) |
1874 DPIO_TX1_STAGGER_MULT(7) |
1875 DPIO_TX2_STAGGER_MULT(5));
1876
1877 /* Deassert data lane reset */
1878 chv_data_lane_soft_reset(encoder, false);
1879
1880 /* Clear calc init */
1881 val = vlv_dpio_read(dev_priv, pipe, VLV_PCS01_DW10(ch));
1882 val &= ~(DPIO_PCS_SWING_CALC_TX0_TX2 | DPIO_PCS_SWING_CALC_TX1_TX3);
1883 val &= ~(DPIO_PCS_TX1DEEMP_MASK | DPIO_PCS_TX2DEEMP_MASK);
1884 val |= DPIO_PCS_TX1DEEMP_9P5 | DPIO_PCS_TX2DEEMP_9P5;
1885 vlv_dpio_write(dev_priv, pipe, VLV_PCS01_DW10(ch), val);
1886
1887 val = vlv_dpio_read(dev_priv, pipe, VLV_PCS23_DW10(ch));
1888 val &= ~(DPIO_PCS_SWING_CALC_TX0_TX2 | DPIO_PCS_SWING_CALC_TX1_TX3);
1889 val &= ~(DPIO_PCS_TX1DEEMP_MASK | DPIO_PCS_TX2DEEMP_MASK);
1890 val |= DPIO_PCS_TX1DEEMP_9P5 | DPIO_PCS_TX2DEEMP_9P5;
1891 vlv_dpio_write(dev_priv, pipe, VLV_PCS23_DW10(ch), val);
1892
1893 val = vlv_dpio_read(dev_priv, pipe, VLV_PCS01_DW9(ch));
1894 val &= ~(DPIO_PCS_TX1MARGIN_MASK | DPIO_PCS_TX2MARGIN_MASK);
1895 val |= DPIO_PCS_TX1MARGIN_000 | DPIO_PCS_TX2MARGIN_000;
1896 vlv_dpio_write(dev_priv, pipe, VLV_PCS01_DW9(ch), val);
1897
1898 val = vlv_dpio_read(dev_priv, pipe, VLV_PCS23_DW9(ch));
1899 val &= ~(DPIO_PCS_TX1MARGIN_MASK | DPIO_PCS_TX2MARGIN_MASK);
1900 val |= DPIO_PCS_TX1MARGIN_000 | DPIO_PCS_TX2MARGIN_000;
1901 vlv_dpio_write(dev_priv, pipe, VLV_PCS23_DW9(ch), val);
1902
1903 /* FIXME: Program the support xxx V-dB */
1904 /* Use 800mV-0dB */
1905 for (i = 0; i < 4; i++) {
1906 val = vlv_dpio_read(dev_priv, pipe, CHV_TX_DW4(ch, i));
1907 val &= ~DPIO_SWING_DEEMPH9P5_MASK;
1908 val |= 128 << DPIO_SWING_DEEMPH9P5_SHIFT;
1909 vlv_dpio_write(dev_priv, pipe, CHV_TX_DW4(ch, i), val);
1910 }
1911
1912 for (i = 0; i < 4; i++) {
1913 val = vlv_dpio_read(dev_priv, pipe, CHV_TX_DW2(ch, i));
1914
1915 val &= ~DPIO_SWING_MARGIN000_MASK;
1916 val |= 102 << DPIO_SWING_MARGIN000_SHIFT;
1917
1918 /*
1919 * Supposedly this value shouldn't matter when unique transition
1920 * scale is disabled, but in fact it does matter. Let's just
1921 * always program the same value and hope it's OK.
1922 */
1923 val &= ~(0xff << DPIO_UNIQ_TRANS_SCALE_SHIFT);
1924 val |= 0x9a << DPIO_UNIQ_TRANS_SCALE_SHIFT;
1925
1926 vlv_dpio_write(dev_priv, pipe, CHV_TX_DW2(ch, i), val);
1927 }
1928
1929 /*
1930 * The document said it needs to set bit 27 for ch0 and bit 26
1931 * for ch1. Might be a typo in the doc.
1932 * For now, for this unique transition scale selection, set bit
1933 * 27 for ch0 and ch1.
1934 */
1935 for (i = 0; i < 4; i++) {
1936 val = vlv_dpio_read(dev_priv, pipe, CHV_TX_DW3(ch, i));
1937 val &= ~DPIO_TX_UNIQ_TRANS_SCALE_EN;
1938 vlv_dpio_write(dev_priv, pipe, CHV_TX_DW3(ch, i), val);
1939 }
1940
1941 /* Start swing calculation */
1942 val = vlv_dpio_read(dev_priv, pipe, VLV_PCS01_DW10(ch));
1943 val |= DPIO_PCS_SWING_CALC_TX0_TX2 | DPIO_PCS_SWING_CALC_TX1_TX3;
1944 vlv_dpio_write(dev_priv, pipe, VLV_PCS01_DW10(ch), val);
1945
1946 val = vlv_dpio_read(dev_priv, pipe, VLV_PCS23_DW10(ch));
1947 val |= DPIO_PCS_SWING_CALC_TX0_TX2 | DPIO_PCS_SWING_CALC_TX1_TX3;
1948 vlv_dpio_write(dev_priv, pipe, VLV_PCS23_DW10(ch), val);
1949
1950 mutex_unlock(&dev_priv->sb_lock);
1951
1952 intel_hdmi->set_infoframes(&encoder->base,
1953 intel_crtc->config->has_hdmi_sink,
1954 adjusted_mode);
1955
1956 g4x_enable_hdmi(encoder);
1957
1958 vlv_wait_port_ready(dev_priv, dport, 0x0);
1959
1960 /* Second common lane will stay alive on its own now */
1961 if (dport->release_cl2_override) {
1962 chv_phy_powergate_ch(dev_priv, DPIO_PHY0, DPIO_CH1, false);
1963 dport->release_cl2_override = false;
1964 }
1965}
1966
1967static void intel_hdmi_destroy(struct drm_connector *connector)
1968{
1969 kfree(to_intel_connector(connector)->detect_edid);
1970 drm_connector_cleanup(connector);
1971 kfree(connector);
1972}
1973
1974static const struct drm_connector_funcs intel_hdmi_connector_funcs = {
1975 .dpms = drm_atomic_helper_connector_dpms,
1976 .detect = intel_hdmi_detect,
1977 .force = intel_hdmi_force,
1978 .fill_modes = drm_helper_probe_single_connector_modes,
1979 .set_property = intel_hdmi_set_property,
1980 .atomic_get_property = intel_connector_atomic_get_property,
1981 .destroy = intel_hdmi_destroy,
1982 .atomic_destroy_state = drm_atomic_helper_connector_destroy_state,
1983 .atomic_duplicate_state = drm_atomic_helper_connector_duplicate_state,
1984};
1985
1986static const struct drm_connector_helper_funcs intel_hdmi_connector_helper_funcs = {
1987 .get_modes = intel_hdmi_get_modes,
1988 .mode_valid = intel_hdmi_mode_valid,
1989 .best_encoder = intel_best_encoder,
1990};
1991
1992static const struct drm_encoder_funcs intel_hdmi_enc_funcs = {
1993 .destroy = intel_encoder_destroy,
1994};
1995
1996static void
1997intel_hdmi_add_properties(struct intel_hdmi *intel_hdmi, struct drm_connector *connector)
1998{
1999 intel_attach_force_audio_property(connector);
2000 intel_attach_broadcast_rgb_property(connector);
2001 intel_hdmi->color_range_auto = true;
2002 intel_attach_aspect_ratio_property(connector);
2003 intel_hdmi->aspect_ratio = HDMI_PICTURE_ASPECT_NONE;
2004}
2005
2006static u8 intel_hdmi_ddc_pin(struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv,
2007 enum port port)
2008{
2009 const struct ddi_vbt_port_info *info =
2010 &dev_priv->vbt.ddi_port_info[port];
2011 u8 ddc_pin;
2012
2013 if (info->alternate_ddc_pin) {
2014 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("Using DDC pin 0x%x for port %c (VBT)\n",
2015 info->alternate_ddc_pin, port_name(port));
2016 return info->alternate_ddc_pin;
2017 }
2018
2019 switch (port) {
2020 case PORT_B:
2021 if (IS_BROXTON(dev_priv))
2022 ddc_pin = GMBUS_PIN_1_BXT;
2023 else
2024 ddc_pin = GMBUS_PIN_DPB;
2025 break;
2026 case PORT_C:
2027 if (IS_BROXTON(dev_priv))
2028 ddc_pin = GMBUS_PIN_2_BXT;
2029 else
2030 ddc_pin = GMBUS_PIN_DPC;
2031 break;
2032 case PORT_D:
2033 if (IS_CHERRYVIEW(dev_priv))
2034 ddc_pin = GMBUS_PIN_DPD_CHV;
2035 else
2036 ddc_pin = GMBUS_PIN_DPD;
2037 break;
2038 default:
2039 MISSING_CASE(port);
2040 ddc_pin = GMBUS_PIN_DPB;
2041 break;
2042 }
2043
2044 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("Using DDC pin 0x%x for port %c (platform default)\n",
2045 ddc_pin, port_name(port));
2046
2047 return ddc_pin;
2048}
2049
2050void intel_hdmi_init_connector(struct intel_digital_port *intel_dig_port,
2051 struct intel_connector *intel_connector)
2052{
2053 struct drm_connector *connector = &intel_connector->base;
2054 struct intel_hdmi *intel_hdmi = &intel_dig_port->hdmi;
2055 struct intel_encoder *intel_encoder = &intel_dig_port->base;
2056 struct drm_device *dev = intel_encoder->base.dev;
2057 struct drm_i915_private *dev_priv = dev->dev_private;
2058 enum port port = intel_dig_port->port;
2059
2060 DRM_DEBUG_KMS("Adding HDMI connector on port %c\n",
2061 port_name(port));
2062
2063 drm_connector_init(dev, connector, &intel_hdmi_connector_funcs,
2064 DRM_MODE_CONNECTOR_HDMIA);
2065 drm_connector_helper_add(connector, &intel_hdmi_connector_helper_funcs);
2066
2067 connector->interlace_allowed = 1;
2068 connector->doublescan_allowed = 0;
2069 connector->stereo_allowed = 1;
2070
2071 intel_hdmi->ddc_bus = intel_hdmi_ddc_pin(dev_priv, port);
2072
2073 switch (port) {
2074 case PORT_B:
2075 /*
2076 * On BXT A0/A1, sw needs to activate DDIA HPD logic and
2077 * interrupts to check the external panel connection.
2078 */
2079 if (IS_BROXTON(dev_priv) && (INTEL_REVID(dev) < BXT_REVID_B0))
2080 intel_encoder->hpd_pin = HPD_PORT_A;
2081 else
2082 intel_encoder->hpd_pin = HPD_PORT_B;
2083 break;
2084 case PORT_C:
2085 intel_encoder->hpd_pin = HPD_PORT_C;
2086 break;
2087 case PORT_D:
2088 intel_encoder->hpd_pin = HPD_PORT_D;
2089 break;
2090 case PORT_E:
2091 intel_encoder->hpd_pin = HPD_PORT_E;
2092 break;
2093 default:
2094 MISSING_CASE(port);
2095 return;
2096 }
2097
2098 if (IS_VALLEYVIEW(dev)) {
2099 intel_hdmi->write_infoframe = vlv_write_infoframe;
2100 intel_hdmi->set_infoframes = vlv_set_infoframes;
2101 intel_hdmi->infoframe_enabled = vlv_infoframe_enabled;
2102 } else if (IS_G4X(dev)) {
2103 intel_hdmi->write_infoframe = g4x_write_infoframe;
2104 intel_hdmi->set_infoframes = g4x_set_infoframes;
2105 intel_hdmi->infoframe_enabled = g4x_infoframe_enabled;
2106 } else if (HAS_DDI(dev)) {
2107 intel_hdmi->write_infoframe = hsw_write_infoframe;
2108 intel_hdmi->set_infoframes = hsw_set_infoframes;
2109 intel_hdmi->infoframe_enabled = hsw_infoframe_enabled;
2110 } else if (HAS_PCH_IBX(dev)) {
2111 intel_hdmi->write_infoframe = ibx_write_infoframe;
2112 intel_hdmi->set_infoframes = ibx_set_infoframes;
2113 intel_hdmi->infoframe_enabled = ibx_infoframe_enabled;
2114 } else {
2115 intel_hdmi->write_infoframe = cpt_write_infoframe;
2116 intel_hdmi->set_infoframes = cpt_set_infoframes;
2117 intel_hdmi->infoframe_enabled = cpt_infoframe_enabled;
2118 }
2119
2120 if (HAS_DDI(dev))
2121 intel_connector->get_hw_state = intel_ddi_connector_get_hw_state;
2122 else
2123 intel_connector->get_hw_state = intel_connector_get_hw_state;
2124 intel_connector->unregister = intel_connector_unregister;
2125
2126 intel_hdmi_add_properties(intel_hdmi, connector);
2127
2128 intel_connector_attach_encoder(intel_connector, intel_encoder);
2129 drm_connector_register(connector);
2130 intel_hdmi->attached_connector = intel_connector;
2131
2132 /* For G4X desktop chip, PEG_BAND_GAP_DATA 3:0 must first be written
2133 * 0xd. Failure to do so will result in spurious interrupts being
2134 * generated on the port when a cable is not attached.
2135 */
2136 if (IS_G4X(dev) && !IS_GM45(dev)) {
2137 u32 temp = I915_READ(PEG_BAND_GAP_DATA);
2138 I915_WRITE(PEG_BAND_GAP_DATA, (temp & ~0xf) | 0xd);
2139 }
2140}
2141
2142void intel_hdmi_init(struct drm_device *dev, int hdmi_reg, enum port port)
2143{
2144 struct intel_digital_port *intel_dig_port;
2145 struct intel_encoder *intel_encoder;
2146 struct intel_connector *intel_connector;
2147
2148 intel_dig_port = kzalloc(sizeof(*intel_dig_port), GFP_KERNEL);
2149 if (!intel_dig_port)
2150 return;
2151
2152 intel_connector = intel_connector_alloc();
2153 if (!intel_connector) {
2154 kfree(intel_dig_port);
2155 return;
2156 }
2157
2158 intel_encoder = &intel_dig_port->base;
2159
2160 drm_encoder_init(dev, &intel_encoder->base, &intel_hdmi_enc_funcs,
2161 DRM_MODE_ENCODER_TMDS);
2162
2163 intel_encoder->compute_config = intel_hdmi_compute_config;
2164 if (HAS_PCH_SPLIT(dev)) {
2165 intel_encoder->disable = pch_disable_hdmi;
2166 intel_encoder->post_disable = pch_post_disable_hdmi;
2167 } else {
2168 intel_encoder->disable = g4x_disable_hdmi;
2169 }
2170 intel_encoder->get_hw_state = intel_hdmi_get_hw_state;
2171 intel_encoder->get_config = intel_hdmi_get_config;
2172 if (IS_CHERRYVIEW(dev)) {
2173 intel_encoder->pre_pll_enable = chv_hdmi_pre_pll_enable;
2174 intel_encoder->pre_enable = chv_hdmi_pre_enable;
2175 intel_encoder->enable = vlv_enable_hdmi;
2176 intel_encoder->post_disable = chv_hdmi_post_disable;
2177 intel_encoder->post_pll_disable = chv_hdmi_post_pll_disable;
2178 } else if (IS_VALLEYVIEW(dev)) {
2179 intel_encoder->pre_pll_enable = vlv_hdmi_pre_pll_enable;
2180 intel_encoder->pre_enable = vlv_hdmi_pre_enable;
2181 intel_encoder->enable = vlv_enable_hdmi;
2182 intel_encoder->post_disable = vlv_hdmi_post_disable;
2183 } else {
2184 intel_encoder->pre_enable = intel_hdmi_pre_enable;
2185 if (HAS_PCH_CPT(dev))
2186 intel_encoder->enable = cpt_enable_hdmi;
2187 else if (HAS_PCH_IBX(dev))
2188 intel_encoder->enable = ibx_enable_hdmi;
2189 else
2190 intel_encoder->enable = g4x_enable_hdmi;
2191 }
2192
2193 intel_encoder->type = INTEL_OUTPUT_HDMI;
2194 if (IS_CHERRYVIEW(dev)) {
2195 if (port == PORT_D)
2196 intel_encoder->crtc_mask = 1 << 2;
2197 else
2198 intel_encoder->crtc_mask = (1 << 0) | (1 << 1);
2199 } else {
2200 intel_encoder->crtc_mask = (1 << 0) | (1 << 1) | (1 << 2);
2201 }
2202 intel_encoder->cloneable = 1 << INTEL_OUTPUT_ANALOG;
2203 /*
2204 * BSpec is unclear about HDMI+HDMI cloning on g4x, but it seems
2205 * to work on real hardware. And since g4x can send infoframes to
2206 * only one port anyway, nothing is lost by allowing it.
2207 */
2208 if (IS_G4X(dev))
2209 intel_encoder->cloneable |= 1 << INTEL_OUTPUT_HDMI;
2210
2211 intel_dig_port->port = port;
2212 intel_dig_port->hdmi.hdmi_reg = hdmi_reg;
2213 intel_dig_port->dp.output_reg = 0;
2214
2215 intel_hdmi_init_connector(intel_dig_port, intel_connector);
2216}
